name: Fully-Loaded Baked Potato Soup
author: Kristine Skaggs Frisone
summary: The thickest and most delicious potato soup ever. I created this soup after having a similar soup at a restaurant.  Incredible comfort food with ease! It's a very simple recipe to adjust to your taste. My family always asks for this soup in the winter. Garnish with chives, bacon crumbles, and Cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 5  Yukon Gold potatoes, cut into eighths
directions: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until crisp, about 10 minutes
Place potatoes in a pot; cover with water
Cook, covered, until tender, 15 to 20 minutes
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add onion and garlic; saute until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes
Stir in bacon crumbles, reserved bacon drippings, flour, salt, and pepper
Reduce heat; add the boiled potatoes, half-and-half, and chicken broth
Add sour cream and 1 cup Cheddar cheese; cook and stir until heated through, about 5 minutes
Garnish soup with remaining Cheddar cheese and parsley
